content: The Java RI Validator throws a warning if a value starts or finishes with whitespace, i couldn't find that in the written spec. (opened GF17157)
i also discussed the possible need of trimming values in Forge with @Michel Rutten to avoid whitespaces at the end or beginning of a value which happen by accident quite a lot

In our discussion we came to the conclusion that modifying user entered data without notifying the user is a bad practice. A possible solution could be a warning invariant on String, but as far as i understand you only can provide regexes with datatypes - without the possibility to define the ConstraintSeverity

Unless someone can provide a usecase for allowing strings to start or end with whitespace, I have no issue with enforcing its removal. It makes processing simpler for everyone downstream (where either removal will have to happen or things will render incorrectly)

What about using whitespace for indenting or centering the first line of a text field or the narrative? Even simple traditionally-formatted prose text starts with a tab for the paragraph indent. It seems useful to allow it, and it isn't clear to me what the issue is necessitating removal.
I don't believe this applies to the narrative, and the markdown type has other ways of doing that
From what I've seen happening in V2, microbiology reports often make use of whitespace to format their text. Please note that "markdown" is not an available datatype for Observation.value[x]!!!
(Should that be a GF, or is that on purpose?)
Whitespace within is fine. It's only leading and trailing whitespace on the value that is a "should" remove
WIthin the narrative, there are other mechanisms if you want to indent or center the first line

there are several difficult issues associated with whitespace. The worst is that XML schema defines whitespace at the start and end of an attribute as insignfiicant, where as Java doesn't. So the spec comments on this explicitly against the formats
the validator is enforcing the format rules

I thought that is what presented form in Diagnostic report is for. We have not really considered this for observations. but there already is a markdown or xhtml extension on the string datatype. Unless implementers start banging on the door insisting it be part of core that is where it will stay for now.
